intro: Pimpinella pruatjan var. depressa, commonly known as the dwarf cow parsley, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
